etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in All the Year Round. From French pébrine from Occitan pebrina (although this is apparently first attested later: 1886) from pebre pepper + -ina

definitions: A disease of silkworms caused by the microsporidian parasite Nosema bombycis, and characterized by the appearance of dark spots on the insect and the stunting of its growth. Also "pébrine disease".
